1PZ.F.summary: Panoro Energy ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas in North and West Africa. The company holds assets in the Dussafu License located in the offshore southern Gabon; and Sfax Offshore Exploration Permit and Ras El Besh Concession located in offshore Tunisia, as well as operates assets on and offshore Tunisia. As of December 31, 2019, its 1P reserves included 6.7 million barrels of oil equivalents (MMBOE); 2P reserves comprised 9.6 MMBOE; and 3P reserves consisted of 12.0 MMBOE. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

1ZD.F.summary: Interoil Exploration and Production ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an upstream oil exploration and production company in Norway. The company engages in the acquisition, exploration, development, and operation of oil and natural gas properties. Its portfolio includes two producing licenses and two exploration licenses in Colombia; and one exploration and seven production concessions in Argentina. The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

3SX.F.summary: OKEA ASA, an oil and gas company, engages in the development and production of oil and gas in the Norwegian continental shelf. It holds interests 44.56% in Draugen, 12% in GjÃ¸a, and 0.55% in Ivar Aasen licenses. The company also has 18 exploration licenses with prospects being evaluated for drilling. The company was incorporated in 2015 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

AKRBP.OL.summary: Aker BP ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The company has working interests in 39 fields/projects. As of December 31, 2020, its total net proven reserves were 641 million barrels of oil equivalents; and estimated total net proven plus probable reserves were 842 million barrels of oil equivalents. The company was formerly known as Det norske oljeselskap ASA and changed its name to Aker BP ASA in October 2016. Aker BP ASA was founded in 2001 and is headquartered in Fornebu, Norway.

ARC.F.summary: Aker BP ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The company has working interests in 39 fields/projects. As of December 31, 2020, its total net proven reserves were 641 million barrels of oil equivalents; and estimated total net proven plus probable reserves were 842 million barrels of oil equivalents. The company was formerly known as Det norske oljeselskap ASA and changed its name to Aker BP ASA in October 2016. Aker BP ASA was founded in 2001 and is headquartered in Fornebu, Norway.

BWE.OL.summary: BW Energy Limited engages in the acquisition, exploration, development, and production of oil and natural gas in West Africa and Brazil. It primarily holds interests in three hydrocarbon licenses located in Dussafu, Gabon; Maromba, Brazil; and Kudu, Namibia. BW Energy Limited was founded in 2016 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

CJ1.F.summary: Norwegian Energy Company ASA, an oil and gas company, focuses on the exploration, development, and production of hydrocarbon resources in Norway, Denmark, and the United Kingdom. Its asset portfolio includes 4 production hubs and 11 producing fields on the Danish Continental Shelf. As of December 31, 2019, the company had proven and probable reserves of 209 million barrels of oil equivalent. Norwegian Energy Company ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

DETNF.summary: Aker BP ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The company has working interests in 39 fields/projects. As of December 31, 2020, its total net proven reserves were 641 million barrels of oil equivalents; and estimated total net proven plus probable reserves were 842 million barrels of oil equivalents. The company was formerly known as Det norske oljeselskap ASA and changed its name to Aker BP ASA in October 2016. Aker BP ASA was founded in 2001 and is headquartered in Fornebu, Norway.

DNO.OL.summary: DNO ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas assets in the Middle East and the North Sea. Its flagship project is the Tawke field that is located in the Kurdistan region of Iraq. As of December 31, 2020, its proven reserves consisted of 201.0 million barrels of oil equivalent (MMboe); proven and probable reserves included 332.3 MMboe; and proven, probable, and possible reserves consisted of 506.8 MMboe. The company was founded in 1971 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.
